sen.j: 南淵請安（みなぶち の しょうあん、生没年不詳）は飛鳥時代の学問僧。
sen.e: MINABUCHI no Shoan (dates of birth and death unknown) was a monk studying abroad in the Asuka Period.

sen.j: 現在の飛鳥川上流の明日香村稲渕に住んだ南淵漢人（みなみぶちのあやひと）と称される渡来系の氏族の知識人。
sen.e: He was an intellectual from the family of a immigrant, called MINABUCHI no Ayahito who lived in the present Inabuchi, Asukamura around the upper Asuka-gawa River.

sen.j: 608年（推古16）、遣隋使小野妹子に従い高向玄理、僧旻ら8人の留学生、留学僧の一人として隋へ留学する。
sen.e: In 608, he accompanied ONO no Imoko, a Japanese envoy to the Sui dynasty of China to study as one of eight students and monks including TAKAMUKO no Kuromaro and Min who was a monk.

sen.j: 32年間、隋の滅亡（618年）から唐の建国の過程を見聞して、640年（舒明12）に高向玄理とともに帰国。
sen.e: After experiencing the process from the fall of Sui Dynasty (618) to the establishment of Tang Dynasty during his 32-year stay, he returned to Japan along with TAKAMUKO no Kuromaro in 640.

sen.j: 隋・唐の進んだ学問知識を日本に伝えた。
sen.e: He introduced Sui's and Tang's advanced knowledge into Japan.

sen.j: 天智天皇と藤原鎌足は請安の塾に通う道すがら蘇我氏打倒の計画を練ったと伝えられる。
sen.e: It is said that Emperor Tenchi and FUJIWARA no Kamatari developed a plan to defeat the Soga clan on their way to the Shoan's school.
